items: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
Bring your right arm across your chest and place your left hand on your right elbow.
Gently pull your right arm towards your left shoulder until you feel a stretch in your upper back and shoulder.
Release and repeat on the other side.

content.title: Reaching Upper Back Stretch Form & Visual

items: Relieves tension and stiffness in the upper back muscles
Improves posture by opening up the chest and shoulders
Increases flexibility and range of motion in the upper back and shoulders
Can help alleviate headaches and neck pain caused by tension in the upper back
Can be done anywhere without any equipment

content.title: Reaching Upper Back Stretch Muscles Worked
